author: Sanjeev Sinha
title: When a share buyback is good for you?
text: According to industry experts, share buybacks are usually announced when a company feels that its shares are undervalued. The share buyback season is back again. Soon after Cognizant Technology announced its share buyback plan, TCS came out with a Rs 16,000-crore buyback offer, and now the board of Coal India arm NLC is said to have approved a Rs 1,244-crore buyback programme. Infosys is another company which is reportedly mulling over a share buyback worth up to $2.5 billion (Rs 17,000 crore). However, the big question is: Should you go for such offers?
